Plastic water bottles.instructions: Empty and rinse. Remove caps if required by local recycling. Place in plastic recycling.

Plastic soda bottles.instructions: Rinse. Crush to save space. Recycle with plastics.

Plastic detergent bottles.instructions: Rinse well. Remove pump tops. Recycle with household plastics.

Plastic shopping bags.instructions: Do NOT place in curbside bins. Bring to grocery store drop-off bins.

Plastic trash bags.instructions: Not recyclable. Dispose in general waste.

Plastic food containers.instructions: Rinse. Check local rules for #5 containers. Foam (#6) often not accepted.

Plastic disposable cutlery.instructions: Not accepted in most recycling programs. Dispose in trash.

Plastic straws.instructions: Too small for recycling machinery. Throw away as general waste.

Plastic cup lids.instructions: Check local rules. Rinse before recycling.

Newspaper.instructions: Bundle or place loosely in paper recycling.

Office paper.instructions: Recycle clean paper. Remove staples if required.

Magazines.instructions: Remove plastic wrap. Place in mixed-paper recycling.

Cardboard boxes.instructions: Flatten boxes. Remove tape and labels if possible.

Glass beverage bottles.instructions: Rinse. Remove caps. Do not break. Recycle by color if required.

Glass cosmetic containers.instructions: Rinse. Remove pumps. Recycle clear glass.

Aluminum soda cans.instructions: Rinse lightly. Crush if needed. Recycle.

Aluminum food cans.instructions: Rinse. Remove labels if required. Recycle.

Aerosol cans.instructions: Must be completely empty. Check local rules for aerosols.

Food waste.instructions: Compost if possible. Otherwise dispose as general waste.

Tea bags.instructions: Compost if 100% paper. If plastic mesh, dispose in trash.

Clothing.instructions: Do not place in curbside bins. Donate or bring to textile recycling.

Shoes.instructions: Reuse/donate if possible. Many cities have shoe recycling programs.
